cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula today, then north toward the northern Gulf Coast Wednesday and accelerating northeast across the southeastern U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast (likely southeast Louisiana/Mississippi area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm warnings only along the northern Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Dzilam) and parts of western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch coast – confined to Yucatan Peninsula and adjacent areas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Yucatan Peninsula, then U.S. northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to western Florida, and inland across the Southeast into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds possible, generally below tropical-storm force (<39 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York, NY & NJ from Zeta
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain (2–4 in) possible Friday, with localized urban/poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor street/river flooding and rough surf along the Atlantic beaches late week
